title: If a removal doesn't mention the word "warning," how do I know whether it is one?
body: Just got a removal and can't tell whether it's a warning or not. The only hint I can guess at is "While we aren't taking any actions against your account at this time" which implies that there might be an action later which sounds like a warning. Clarification please?

replies.body:
Typically, non-warning infractions will include explicit wording that it **isn't** a warning, just simply a removal.

For the post you are referring to, that was intended to be a warning.

> [{quoted}](name=Wilk Rycerz,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=E2oPOZsE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-07-04T03:48:55.654+0000)
>
> Typically, non-warning infractions will include explicit wording that it **isn't** a warning, just simply a removal.
> 
> For the post you are referring to, that was intended to be a warning.

Okay, thanks.

Is it okay if I switch to canned responses (rather original and thus "untested" content) to avoid similar missteps in the future?
